author: Staff Reporter
text:
Nearly 4,000 persons participated in the ‘Run for Green Revolution’, a marathon organsied by Ver Youth Foundation here on Sunday.

Explain

T. Jerome Vasanth, the founder of the organisation, said that all the participants were asked to plant one tree and to nurture it. He added that the participants were asked to explain benefits of trees when someone tried to axe a tree, even at their own premises.

Mr. Jerome said that members of the organisation are maintaining a few thousand trees that they have planted since the founding of the organisation in May last year. They plan to plant 10,000 more saplings in March and maintain them. “We are striving hard to bring back the climate that the city enjoyed a few years ago,” he said.

India’s first blade runner Major D.P. Singh flagged off the rally near All Souls Church.

The rally was conducted for men and women, besides boys and girls in five and 10 km categories.

Cash prizes to the tune of Rs. one lakh, prizes and medals were given away to 40 persons who secured the first five places in the eight categories.

Mr. Singh planted a vembu tree sapling at Vadavalli to conclude the rally.
title: Green marathon to create awareness on growing trees
